document_data.name: ''Horn Totem''
document_data.mainbody: The '''''horn totem''''' was a [[dagger]] crafted from the horn of a dead [[Oni mage|oni]] known as the [[Ogre King]]. It was considered to be of great religious significance to the [[goblin]]s who worshiped the Ogre King as a [[demigod]] from within the [[Barrow of the Ogre King]] in the [[Delimbiyr Vale]].
document_data.Description: The horn itself was straight and black. The base was wrapped in [[leather]] and the point was sharp enough to allow it to be wielded like a crude dagger.
document_data.Powers: The dagger was a ''[[goblin totem]]'', meaning that merely holding it imbued the wielder with a confidence to face enemies much larger than they were, and thus made the wielder just a bit more dangerous when fighting bigger enemies.
document_data.History:
The ''horn totem'' was fashioned by goblin worshipers of the Ogre King sometime after his death in the early 15{{th}} century [[DR]], alongside a [[mace]] made of his skull known as the ''[[skull totem]]''. When the goblins' [[shaman|High Shaman]], [[Sancossug]], began plotting to revive the Ogre King in the late 1470s DR, these totems became vital as he believed he needed the Ogre King's skeleton to be as intact as possible.

In the {{YearlinkName|1479}}, the ''horn totem'' was stolen from the Barrow of the Ogre King by a [[wizard]] known as [[Curuvar the Brazen]]. In response to this theft, the goblins raided the town, blowing a hole in the southern wall with [[alchemist's fire]]
